newsitem.title: USA: U.S. spot resid fuel prices tank with crude.
newsitem.headline: U.S. spot resid fuel prices tank with crude.

text.p: U.S. spot residual fuel prices fell Thursday in moderate trade, as buyers eyed sinking crude and lackluster utility demand, industry sources said.

"Resid prices certainly came off pretty hard with crude. You can't find a buyer for anything right now," said one cash trader, noting utility interest even before the crude slide was almost non-existent.
In New York Harbor, physical one percent skidded $1.25 to the $19.50-75 area, with NYH November paper done early at $19.65 but quoted later at $19.00-50, traders said.
NYH December one percent paper, sold early at $20.15, was talked later in the $19.50-75 area. Q1 paper was quoted late at $19.40-65, traders said.
High sulphurs in NYH lost a dollar or more, with 2.2 percent now pegged at $18.50-75 and three percent at $17.75.
At the U.S. Gulf, one percent eased a quarter to $18.25-50, while three percent fell $1 to the low-$17 area.

New York City gate baseload gas sold Thursday at $3.38/mmBtu versus NYH one percent November paper at a $3.06/mmBtu equivalent. December gas in New York was quoted near $4/mmBtu compared to NYH one percent December paper at a $3.12 equivalent.
